description: From scientific Latin Anthracotherium (genus name; see Anthracotherium § Etymology); surface analysis, anthraco- +‎ there from Ancient Greek θηρίον (thēríon, “beast”).

entries.meaning: (paleontology) Any of several artiodactyl ungulates, of the extinct family Anthracotheriidae, related to the hippopotamus. [from 19th c.]
examples: One mysterious anthracocthere known as Diplopus  […]  entered Europe just before la grande coupure, presumably by swimming the Turgai Strait.
